intro: Bramia micromonnieria, commonly known as the small-fruited bramia, is a species of flowering plant in the family Araceae. It is native to tropical regions of Central and South America, where it thrives in humid, shaded environments. The plant is characterized by its compact growth habit and distinctive, arrow-shaped leaves. Its inflorescence consists of a spadix surrounded by a modified leaf called a spathe, typical of the Araceae family. Bramia micromonnieria is often found in wetlands and along riverbanks, where it plays a role in maintaining local biodiversity.
